p: We used amplicon-based MiSeq sequencing to characterize the bacterial communities of Ae. mcintoshi and Ae. ochraceus, the primary vectors of RVFV in Kenya. Our findings reveal that the two mosquito species harbor distinct microbial communities and that Ae. ochraceus has a more diverse microbial community compared to Ae. mcintoshi. The microbial communities of the two mosquito species were also strongly influenced by the site of collection. Proteobacteria (53.5%), Firmicutes (22.0%) and Actinobacteria (10.0%) were the most abundant phyla which is consistent with previous findings on microbiota of field-collected mosquitoes [ 17â€“ 20].
